column4: There seems to be a small bug in the Ubuntu AMD64 iso... mainly it won't boot. It is unable to mount /dev/sda(b)(c)(d)(etc..) and just sits there... or goes to a blank screen.
Any ideas?
I was *so* hoping to install Ubuntu on my rig tonight. Has anyone else encountered this problem? I can boot the same ISO in a virtual machine.
oh, one other thing. The VERY first message on the output says something about an error in line 7.
Has anyone had issues booting with the 64-bit edition of 10.04?
FeasabilityStudy: How do I do that?

if you're on a linux box now, just open the terminal, go to the location where the .iso is.  And then run "sha256sum ubuntu-x86-iso" or whatever the name is..  then compare that hash with the one on the ubuntu site
http://releases.ubuntu.com/10.04/
click on the version you have and it will show all MD5's for it.
check the sha256sum as well, just to make sure
sha256sum ubuntu-10.04-.iso, etc.
sha256sum ubuntu-10.04
post the output here and I will check it for you
There should be.  You can also try sha1sum
That is not a good sha256sum.  in other words it dont match..
SORRY
Yes, it DOES match..
I was looking at sha1sum instead of sha256sum.  Sorry.  Yes, that checksum you gave me does match
Did you install via a CD?  If so, did you verify the CD burned properly?
Ok, I must have come in after you were asking what your problem was.  What was it again?
My apologies for what may look like impatience. Did you get my last message?
No what was the problem again?
